pros: Overall was a nice place to work with supportive and friendly staff around you, especially being at the Freeport site which was smaller and more like a small, closer community

pros: There are several benefits to working at Grand River Food. Here are a few: Competitive pay: Grand River Food offers competitive wages and benefits packages to its employees. Opportunities for growth: As a growing company, there are often opportunities for employees to advance their careers within the organization. Positive work environment: The company has a friendly and collaborative work environment that promotes teamwork and positive communication among employees.
cons: Working in the food industry can be physically demanding, involving standing for long periods, moving heavy equipment, and working in hot or cold conditions. Stressful environment: The fast-paced nature of the food industry can be stressful for some workers, particularly during busy periods. Low pay: Some jobs in the food industry may pay minimum wage, which may be insufficient for some workers.

job_title: Registered Nurse, Ontario Nurses' Association in Kitchener, ON
pros: Great co-workers and good management. There is an overall positive atmosphere and a good interdisciplinary approach to patient care.
cons: My unit can be largely understaffed at times, which makes some shifts extremely busy. A lot of our equipment is outdated and my unit badly needs a renovation! The patient rooms and bathrooms are way too small, making it hard to work with the patients at times.

pros: Patient oriented- managment always looking out for what is best for both patients and workers. I enjoy how fair everything is and I always enjoy coming to work. Very clean enviroment.
cons: Parking is horrid.. tha's no surprise. Budget cuts, and the whole "do just as well or better than you were doing but do it cheaper and faster with less supplies" is bad. Lots of stress to keep patient numbers up even though a lot of it is out of our control. Causes unnecassary stress.

pros: Nice place to work! Working environment is great! The radiation program is very well constructed. The patient can have a comfortable feeling during the course of radiation treatment.
cons: Parking is a little bit far away! The cafeteria is not as good as Tim Horton, while a long line at Tim Horton.
